3 rangers were killed in a battle with Moran cattle raiders in Archers Post.

Al Shabaab militants raided Omar Jilo, in northern Kenya, where they clashed with police forces. 2 local administrators were killed and 2 police reservists were abducted. Security personnel are pursuing the attackers.

Cattle rustlers attacked the village of Seretion on 09/05/2017, recovering goats that had been stolen three days earlier. A police reservist and a suspected robber were killed in the shootout. Hundreds of locals are fleeing now to safer places, as similar attacks have taken place in the region recently.

notes: Police engage communal gunmen who attacked a conservationist. Two killed

Pokot raiders and police reservists engage in a firefight in Keiyo Valley on 22/04/2017. Four Pokot warriors and two civilians were killed in the shootout. According to the source, the attack could have been politically motivated and meant to intimidate communities not to take part in the Jubilee Coalition nominations.

notes: Two General Service Unit (GSU) officers are reported missing following a weekend shootout with herders at Matweku near the Laikipia Nature Conservancy at the border of Laikipia and Baringo counties.
Pokot militia raided several villages in Marakwet East, but were repulsed by the police.
Pokot militia raided several villages in Marakwet East, but were repulsed by the police.
There were intense firefights between Pokot militias and government forces near Olmaiso, in Laikipia.

Pokot raiders attacked Matweku police post in Ol Ari Nyiro Nature Conservancy, killing a police officer and abducting two others on 13/04/2017. Later the captured policemen were found dead at Kamwenje in Baringo. It is believed that the policemen were killed by Pokots.
A police officer and a civilian died in a firefight between Pokot militias and government forces near Olmaiso, in Laikipia, on 13/04/2017.
At least seven Pokot were killed by police during a security operation in Tiaty, Baringo County. The gunmen were allegedly planning a livestock raid.
4 people are killed by herders in Nakwomuru village in central Pokot county. Police reservists engage with the raiders, killing three of them
Pokot gunmen open fire at Ol Moran livestock market in bid to steal cattle. There are no references to injuries. But the police engage the gunmen in a battle later. No deaths reported
Mukutan Lodge was attacked by herders seeking pasture. They exchanged gunfire with the security forces and burned down the lodge.
Three are killed in a clash between Turkana and Samburu militias. The clash was sparked by revenge for cattle theft.
At least 10 people have been killed in Kom, Isiolo County between Borana and Samburu militias. The clash was spurred over drought.
On 19/03 in Mukutani, four police officers were wounded when suspected Pokot herdsmen fired on their vehicle as they escorted members of the Ilchamus community to safety.
The KDF engaged Al Shabaab fighters at Kolbio.

notes: Pokot fighters attacked a Red Cross convoy that was evacuating children injured in the attack on Mukutani the previous evening. 4 police officers were injured.

In a continuance of ethnic violence, two Pokot woman are killed by suspected Tugen-Ilchamus raiders, after an attack on a police vehicle. It is not clear if the Pokot women were affiliated with the police, or if the police were simply caught in crossfire. In retaliation, Pokot militias soon after attacked Mukutan market, killing five women and four children and looting shops and homes. Other were reported injured.

Two are dead in a clash between Tugen-Ilchamus and Pokot group after the former attempted a raid to steal cattle in Baringo County. The clash lead to further ethnic violence in the following days. Exact location in Baringo was not reported by the source, though it stands to reason the violence occurred in Mukutani ward, as subsequent attacks occurred in Mukutan.

Auliyan militia attacked Duse centre in Isiolo County in a retaliatory attack following their expulsion for the area by government forces weeks prior. Five killed, six injured. Two of the attackers were shot and killed by police.
Al-Shabaab fighters have attacked a Kenyan military convoy at Lamu. Al Shabaab claimed killing four. Kenya acknowledged the attack, but said only one was killed.
On 04/03, a police helicopter was shot at by Pokot or Samburu raidersas security officers carried out aerial surveillance.

Eight are dead in clashes between Tugen-Ilchamus and Pokot clans during the weeks of 26/02-12/03, exact dates, location and other details not known. Accounting for the activity between the clans in the present week, the fatality total stands at 21.
Security forces kill a suspected al Shabaab member in Kwale and recover weapons.
Three are killed in clashes over land in the Athi River area. Following, police made 92 arrests.
A fight between a Pokot and Marakwet near Kerio River led to the death of one.
A police officer was hacked to death at Mangala in Makueni County by a group of sand harvesters over the right to land.
At least 12 houses were torched in Pimbinyiet, Trans Mara West after clashes between two communities lasted over two days.
At least 12 houses were torched in Pimbinyiet, Trans Mara West after clashes between two communities lasted over two days.
Armed herders trespassing on illegal land shoot and injure a police officer after they were confronted near Rumuruti.

100+ gunmen believed to be al-Shabaab attacked a police post and destroyed communication masts in Arabia area, Mandera County. At least one bystander died in the attack. Number of other casualties not known, as al Shabaab had destroyed communication masts in the area. Shabelle Media Network reports an 'unknown number of police officers were killed.'
Three are killed in a land dispute in Kanyakwar. The following day a group protest at the office of the 'assistant chief', claiming he 'had a hand in the dispute.'
On 16 January 2017, Kowow clan and residents of Maron sub-location clashed. Several houses were torched in Marakwet East after the body of a 62 year old woman was found.

A bystander student was killed on Sunday as renewed clashes between the Kipsigis and Maasai communities escalated at Pimbinyiet on the Trans Mara West-Trans Mara East border in Narok County. A similar clash took place at the location on 04/01.
One is dead following clashes between Kipsigis and Maasai militias at Pimbinyiet on the Trans Mara West-Trans Mara East border in Narok County.
On 26 December 2016, 20 people were injured as residents from Matundura and Gituro villages (Naivasha and Kinangop constituencies) clashed over a boundary dispute.
On 24 December 2016, one person was shot and injured when suspected Pokot militia raided Chemwoyo and Murkutwo. Marakwet herders retaliated leading to an hour of heavy gunfire.

One attacker died and three police officers were wounded Friday after a group of men armed with machetes and bows assaulted a coastal police post to steal guns, an official said. No group has claimed responsibility, but initial suspicion has fallen on a secessionist group called the Mombasa Republican Council that wants the coastal region to secede from Kenya, claiming marginalization.

Three people were on 21/12 are killed in Esoit, Trans Mara West (outside Kilgoris) in Narok County as fighting between the Kipsigis and Maasai communities. The fighting was an escalation of tit-for-tat attacks the previous day.

On 20 December 2016, interclan skirmishes were reported in the Kerio Valley. This is a continuation from the previous day. 25 houses were burned and two people were killed in total in the attacks. Fatalities coded on 19 December.
Military forces kill four members of al Shabaab in Hulugho during the mid-morning of 15/12.

Suspected Al-Shabaab have attacked Dabacity in Elwak, Mandera County and destroyed a Safaricom telecommunication mast. County Commissioner Fredrick Shisia said the attack occurred at about 1.45am on 12/12.The attackers overpowered five security operatives guarding the mast, causing them to flee.
A military patrol encounters and kill four suspected members of al Shabaab in the Hulugho area on 09/12.

On 27 November 2016, a woman was killed and a 12-year old girl injured in a shootout near Lomelo between armed pastoralists. The Rift Valley coordinator dismissed reports that 14 people were shot dead.
A clash between Jimo and Agoro clans lasts over two days. One death reported the first day, two the second.
A clash between Jimo and Agoro clans lasts over two days. One death reported the first day, two the second.
Al Shabaab, numbering 50, attacks a police station in Liboi. One of the assailants was killed and several seriously injured during a gunbattle.
Ethnic clash over rights of a watering hole near Molot. Several houses were burnt in the melee.

At least four more people have been killed in raging armed conflict between Borana and Somali herders (Auliyan) along the Isiolo-Garissa border [northeastern Kenya]. The fighting took place in Tana village about 11km north of Garba-Tula town on Saturday [10 September].
One is dead following a fight between two rival communities Kuri, Isiolo County on 14/08.

Police have gunned down a al Shabaab terror suspect and recovered two hand grenades in Vingirika (Diani) village, Kwale County. The suspect Mohamed Bakari was shot dead by Anti-terrorism detectives after he hauled a hand grenade at the officers.
Four police officers were injured during an attack by suspected Al-Shabaab militants who tried to force their way into the Basuba General Service Unit (GSU) camp in Lamu East on Saturday evening.

A Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) convoy was ambushed after their vehicle overran an explosive in Fino Town, Mandera County. Between 6 and 10 causalities. Elsewhere in Fino on the same date Al Shabaab destroys a communication mast in Fino and engage police in a gunfight. Four injuries.
An al-Shabaab suspect was killed in Kenyas coastal town of Lamu in a foiled dawn attack at a local police station. One officer was injured.

A suspected [al Shabaab] held at a police station in western Kenya grabbed a gun and shot at police officers, killing between six, leading to a hostage situation. Despite initial reports, the police force later revealed the shooter was likely a disgruntled police officer.
Police officers, on their way to Lamu, escaped death by a whisker after al Shabaab militia men attempted to attack their vehicle which was heading to Mokowe in Lamu County on Sunday.

More than 100 Al Shabaab raided Diff Police station in Wajir on early Saturday morning, stealing firearms and bullets. They left one police officer wounded, and are believed to have escaped with serious injuries during an exchange of fire with officers during the 1 am incident. Al Shabaab gained control of the town after several hours of fighting. The Somali Memo reports causalities without number.
Suspected [al Shabaab] was on Wednesday morning shot dead by police in Kibundani, Msambweni Sub County.
Police shoot and kill a al Shabaab suspect in Kwale town.
Al Shabaab claims it has killed 6 KDF soldiers in an ambush attack on a base of Kenyan troops in Lamu Island near Somalia border. KDF denies either the attack took place or the causality figure.
Kenyan forces kill four members of al Shabaab in Milimani and recover weapons.
Anti-terrorism police on 20/06 thwarted an attack and killed a wanted al-Shabaab fighter in the coastal town of Kwale.
Two are dead in or near Kopere trading centre over a land control issue. Violence related to the land continued in the general area midweek.
Four people were shot and killed while one person is missing as renewed inter-clan fighting erupted at Kachamcham farm, Kerio Valley in Elgeyo-Marakwet County.
Al Shabaab fighters attack a police station in Dif on 10/04, injuring three officers before escaping in the police vehicle.
Security forces kill four members of al Shabaab and recover weapons in Boni Forest on 02/02.

Three people were killed while another one was seriously injured after morans from two communities clashed over land in Leparua on the Isiolo-Laikipia border. The identity of the actors are not known.

Suspected al Shabaab ambushed a police convoy in Lamu on the afternoon of 01/01, injuring security officials and setting a police truck on fire. There was a fierce gun battle at the scene preceded by an explosion. Shortly after the attack police forces in the area launched a large security operation.
Three are killed in renewed clashes between Kalenjin and Maasais groups in the Olposimoru area of Narok on 27/12.
Four are injured in continued clashes between Kalenjin and Maasais groups on 26/12 in the Olposimoru area of Narok.

Many houses are destroyed, causing 2,000 residents to flee following renewed violence between Kalenjins and Maasais groups in the Olposimoru area of Narok on 25/12. Causalities, injuries from the clash are not known.
Four police officers are feared dead following an al Shabaab attack on Bodhei, Lamu County on 25/12.
Two headers are killed in violence between Kalenjin and Maasais in Maasai Mau Narok forest, Narok South Sub-County on 23/12.
Two are killed during a gun battle between al Shabaab and security forces in Milihoi.
Al Shabaab attacks Kenyan forces in Lamu on 06/12, seven soldiers killed, ten wounded.
Ethiopian-OLF forces and Kenyan police clash in Sololo on 19/11, three police dead. The clash began following an OLF invasion in the area.
One dead, eleven injured and property destroyed in a clash over sand harvesting in Kasikeu.

A young boy is killed during clashes over land between Kapkeny and Kabasirian clans in Kerio Valley. Later reported suggest the battle caused the destructions of many homes and displaced hundreds. Fighting also spilled over into Shaban and Kachesoom areas.

Nine are dead and six are injured in a fight between pastoralists and farmers in Tana River. Additionally, several houses were destroyed. The clashes between Wardei pastoralists and Mijikenda farmers occurred in Wachu Oda in Garsen. A reported 1,500 people displaced as a result of the clashes.
KDF soldiers killed three al Shabaab when they repulsed an attack at Basuba, Lamu county, on Wednesday (29/07) morning. Three members of the military forces were injured.
Another person dies in a clan war over land on 12/07.
One person dies in a clash between the Kabasiran and Kapkeny clans in Elgeyo Marakwet.
Al Shabaab attacks a police convoy, including a civilian bus travelling in Mkunumbi, no reported causalities.

Al Shabaab attacks several locations of Lamu Island and were able to briefly overtake the area known as 'Mangai,' an area they found with little resistance. Other places attacked included a school and a military camp. Military forces eventually repelled the attackers. 'Several' casualties reported, eleven of which were recorded as al Shabaab. Later reports suggest a British-born member of al Shabaab (known as Thomas Evans or Abdul Akim) may have been a leader in the attack and is among the dead. Another suspect of the attack was apprehended on 20/06.

At least 10 pastoralists from Isiolo have been killed in clashes with Laikipia residents after the herders invade the area with hundreds of animals. The herders also shot two security personnel after they were ordered to vacate the land during the clashes.
At least three people were killed and several others injured on the morning of 06/06 in inter-community clashes at Lowangila in Isiolo County. The clash may be related to rights to cattle or land.
Al Shabaab attacks a police post Yumbis on the night of 25/05, killing 20. Al Shabaab had also attacked the area the previous week.
Al Shabaab gunmen attack Yumbis and Wel Marer villages in Fafi, each about 80 Km north east of Garissa. Security forces pushed back the attackers, no reported causalities.
Al Shabaab gunmen attack Yumbis and Wel Marer villages in Fafi, each about 80 Km north east of Garissa. Security forces pushed back the attackers, no reported causalities.

Turkana raiders attack a Pokot village close to Nadome along the Turkana-East Pokot district border, killing 18 residents. Following the attack a Pokot militia assembled, chasing the attackers to nearby Kogh-Tuw village and killing 36.
Kenyan police on 11/04 shot dead two al Shabaab suspects in an incident that left one police officer injured in Kwale.

Three pirates have been shot dead in Migingo Island by Ugandan security forces. The pirates, believed to be Tanzanian nationals, were accosted inside the lake while robbing fishermen. Three other pirates were arrested. Kenya and Uganda have both staked claim to the fish-rich island - a row that has lasted since 2002.
Two unidentified sub tribes clash over land at Kathanje (Kathangei), Chuka Igambangombe constituency. One death, plus other injuries reported.
Tugan and Pokot militias exchange fire over grazing land and cattle ownership at Kapndasum in Marigat. An unarmed bystander was killed in the shootout, several others missing.
Three men are killed when Kikuyu and Maasai groups clashed over a farms ownership.
The Kenya Defence Forces killed eight al Shabaab and injured several others during an encounter with the insurgents in Basuba, Lamu county. A KDF soldier died while three others were injured.
Pokot gunmen killed a school guard during the late morning hours. Motive unknown.
A hotel security guard is shot and killed and his colleague injured after ten gunmen dressed in police uniform attacked the two in Diani. Perpetrators not identified.
At least ten people are killed following two days of ethnic clashes in Kinango, Kwale County. Both communities claimed grazing rights on a ranch.
At least ten people are killed following two days of ethnic clashes in Kinango, Kwale County. Both communities claimed grazing rights on a ranch.
One man was seriously injured and property worth thousands of shillings destroyed after members of the Kikuyu and Maasai communities clashed over a parcel of land near Eburu Forest.
Two people were injured as herders from the Tugen community battled suspected Pokot bandits. The battle broke out at Chemoe, near the Baringo North and Tiaty subcounty border.
At least five people were killed and four others reported missing following clashes in Dukana, Marsabit County or rights to cattle and property.

At least eight people were killed and four others seriously injured in inter- communal clashes in northern Kenyas Isiolo County. The clash reportedly lasted for several hours. The clash occurred at Leruko on Isiolo side, a few meters from the bridge that connects Isiolos Buffalo Springs game reserve with Samburu Park.

A security operation against a group of Pokot militia yields the recovery of weapons and the deaths of six bandits, who had been launching attacks in the area recently. An MP said banditry attacks were instigated by people who want Kapedo to be annexed to Baringo.

At least 24 police officers and Kenya Police Reservists (KPR) are feared dead, 17 injured, in a fresh attack in Kapedo in Tiaty Sub-county Baringo County after Pokot raiders attacked the at Lomelo and Kapau areas of the city.

Seven police members are dead and 17 missing following an attack on their post by local tribesmen. Attackers targeted three police vehicles and burned one of them. The motive for the attack is not known. A similar attack occurred in the area the previous week.
Suspected local tribesmen attack a police post in Kapedo. Five dead, including three police officers.
Unknown gunmen killed a police officer near the border with Somalia before escaping.
Rival Maasai groups clash over land ownership at a farm in Nakuru. One death, one injury reported.

Anti-terrorism police forces gun down a suspected and wanted al Shabaab member during an early morning raid on their hideout. It is believed the target of the operation was responsible for the killing of a German tourist.

One civilian is killed and two police officers injured in an attack on a lorry carrying supplies for a food programme. The attackers are unknown, but are believed to be related to an ongoing clash between the Degodia and Garre clans.
A clash between Garre and Degodia clans continue into a second day. Two additional combatants killed. The Garre may have been from Ethiopia, who came later to reinforce the Kenyan Garre.
Twenty dead (range as high as 30) and 300 displaced as a result of a seven-hour ethnically driven gun battle in Rhamu. Police have made at least one arrest and recovered various light arms.
Samburu and Borana herders clash over a water source. Four killed, two each side.

Suspected al Shabaab attack a police post in Bothai around the midnight hour between Monday and Tuesday. The ensuing gun battle lasted five hours, eventually causing the police forces to abandon their post. After the police fled the gunmen ransacked the village, stealing drugs. Deaths reported, though no hard numbers were provided.

Two police officers were injured during the evening hours injured after al Shabaab gunmen attacked a police station in Mandera. The gang of about 100 is said to have attacked at the Fino Police station in the night using rifles.
Unidentified gunmen attack a Mombasa-bound bus outside of Witu, kill seven, including police officers. The following morning al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

A group of 30 to 50 armed men, believed to be attached to the recent attacks in Hindi, attack Gamba police station (Ndeu area) during the evening hours. The attackers overpowered the security officers the torched the station. One officer reported dead, two others injured. Shabelle Media Network reports nine officers dead.
At least 12 people were killed when attackers managed to get a suspected ringleader of Mpeketoni attacks out of a police station in Kenyas Tana Delta County.

Six suspected militants have been killed at the Timau police road block during a shoot out with police during the morning hours. Buuri OCPD said the six are suspected to be militants although the County Commander says the six were poachers.
At least 20 (some reports 30) have been killed in ethnic clashes in Tarbaj involving the Degodia and Garre clans. The fighting stemmed from a boundary dispute. The clash may have occurred on 21/06.

Five suspects linked to the two Mpeketoni attacks have been shot dead in Bochai area in Mpeketoni, Lamu county by security personnel. The ministry say three AK 47 guns and several bullets were recovered in Bochai after the incident.

At least 10 more people were killed during the night-time hours in a second attack in Mpeketoni, Porokomo, Lamu County area by al Shabaab. Police said gunmen raided Poromoko village and set several houses ablaze. Al Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack claiming they had killed 20 police and wildlife wardens. Other sources claim 15 deaths.

Suspected al-Shabaab militants killed two Kenya Defense Forces (KDF) soldiers and injured another at the common frontier with Somalia, police have said. The divisional police commander, who confirmed the incident, said the officers were attacked by the insurgents who emerged from the bonny forest along Lamu-Malindi road on a Pick-Up vehicle.
Unidentified attackers raid a police camp, making off with weapons. No reported injuries or causalities.

The funeral of a politicians wife is disrupted by clashes of opposing political parties, namely supporters of after Governor Okoth Obado and Siaya Senator James Orengo of the PDM and ODM. Injuries not known.
Police in Diani Town of Kwale County [southern Kenya] on [25 April] morning gunned down an Al-Shabab terror suspect they believe has been behind a spate of criminal activities.
Five are hurt during a ethnically driven clash over rights to a pasture.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines. Of the dead, two were killed on 07/03 and three on 08/03.

A group of farmers clashed with pastoralists over grazing land around Lake Naivasha. The farmers who claim to be members of the Mau Mau group accused the herders of driving their animals into the farms. Causalities not known or reported.

Six people were injured during a confrontation between farmers and pastoralists at Mtondoni area in Hongwe ward, Lamu West district. The conflict ensued when pastoralists were accused of driving their animals into the farms and destroying crops. The identities of the two groups is not known.

Ethiopian Merrile militia attack a group of fishermen in the north-west Turkana border district, on Lake Turkana, killing one and injuring several others. The motive for the attack is not clear, though several similar raid had been persistent in the area. Responding to the fishermens distress calls, Kenyan police battled the Merrile, pushing them back into Ethiopia. No causality figures provided from the police battle.

Unidentified militia, believed to be from nearby Ethiopia attack the ethnic Gabra border town of North Horr, killing two police and injuring 'scores' of civilians. It was reported cattle was stolen in the raid.
One is killed and two are others injured in a ethnic clash over the course of two days.
One is killed and two are others injured in a ethnic clash over the course of two days.
A hand grenade is thrown at a police officer in the Diani area. The ordinance did not explode. The perpetrators escaped.

A Kenya police reservist was shot dead by unidentified armed raiders in a fresh attack at Turkwel on Pokot-Turkana border. The police officer of the Turkana ethnic group, though it was not clear if ethnicity was the motive for the attack.
Al Shabaab launches an attack on a border town, killing three civilians and five police. Liboi hosts an AMISOM military, often used to supply forces in Somalia.

Two General Service Unit officers (paramilitary wing of the Kenyan Military) were injured when a vehicle they were travelling in was attacked in West Pokot county. The attackers may have been thieves.

At least 12 people were killed with many others injured in Marsabit county of northern Kenya following clashes between rival militia groups, Borana and Burji, Gabra. The clash caused 30,000 nearby Moyale residents, fearing for their safety, to flee north into Ethiopia. Clashes were sporadic throughout the week, though no specific date is provided. Some sources have causality totals at 70 or more.

Police forces launch an operation to retake police posts occupied by Pokot militia. The Pokot militiamen responded with 'heavy resistance.' It is not clear if the operation was successful. Causalities not known.

Armed Pokot militiamen attack and hold hostage three police posts in Lorokon village. It is not clear how many police officers are effected by the attack. Causalities not known. The siege is likely related to a border dispute between the Pokots and Turkana communities that has been causing tension in the area.
A clash between Ganze police and MRC youths leads to a gunshot wound of a bystander civilian.

Three people were shot dead after youths armed with arrows attacked Ruga police post in Muhoroni Sub County. The three are reported to have been shot dead in an arrow and fire exchange at Nyangore sub-location in Chemelil. The youths are suspected to have come from Nandi community. The youths had vowed to kill a senior police officer, accusing police of contributing to the rampant chaos along the nearby border area.
Four people have died following inter-Tribal conflict in Waso Rongai Village, Baragoi. The groups involved were not identified.
A group of police who were returning from patrol opened fire on a group of men planting an IED along the side of the road the night of 11/10. The police failed to hit or capture any of the men.

A crowd of squatters believed to be composed of Nandi youths invaded a farm belonging to a former judge and attacked an AP officer who was guarding the premise. The motive for the attack is believed to be concerning the control of land.

The more than 200 cross-border Ugandan-Pokot raiders attacked Apuko village in Pokot North and drove away the animals after a fierce morning battle with Pokot herdsmen and security officers. Causalities not known.

The more than 200 cross-border Ugandan-Pokot raiders attacked Apuko village in Pokot North and drove away the animals after a fierce morning battle with Pokot herdsmen and security officers. Causalities not known.
Garre and Degodia militia clashed at Meriley water dam in Banissa District in the afternoon of 16/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. No causalities reported.
A group of Ethiopian Dassanach cross the shared border and kill a police reservist along the west bank of the Lake Turkana.
Dassanach raiders enter Kenya near Lake Turkana, kill a police reservist and injure two others at a post at Loarengak.
Kenyan forces stationed in Madera County chase several al Shabaab fighters into Beled Hawo following cross-border gunfire. Causalities not known.

Twenty Al-Shabab militiamen are killed by the Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] near the border town of Hulugho, Garissa. The militants were crossing the border to Somalia and are believed to be part of a group of nearly 40 militiamen who attacked an Administration Police camp at Galmagala Division last Friday [16 August] evening killing four Administration Police officers.
An ethnic clash over land caused one death along the Trans Mara West and Kuria East district border.

Movement of forces: The government decides to deploy 130,000 police officers to the locations of Homa Bay Migori, Siaya, Kisumu and Migori to protect voters.

Non-violent activity: Police raid the house of former Kakamega Senator Boni Khalwale in search for materials that can be used to disrupt the Thursday election. The police claims that Mr. Khalwale was storing tyres to provide to mobilised youth, which would use them to light pyres.

Movement of forces: The government's military operation in Boni Forest meant to flash out suspected al-Shabab militants is set to be extended for an unspecified period in Lamu, Garissa and Tana River counties.

Officers conducting the ongoing multi-agency security Operation in Lamu have discovered and destroyed three key Al-Shabaab hideouts at Lango la Simba in Witu Division of Lamu West. The raids took place on or before 10/09.

Property destruction: Al-Shabab fighters attacked the Kenyan village of Gamba in Tana River County [in the country's coastal region], targeting government installations in the area. The extent of the damage or whether anyone was killed or injured in the attack is not year clear. Phone networks in the area broke down after the raid.
Al Shabaab militants destroyed an electricity pylon near Gamba, causing a blackout across Lamu county.
Property destruction: Houses were burned in villages on the Isiolo-Meru border as part of an ongoing border conflict between the counties.
Movement of forces: On 5 July, the government deployed troops to Lamu to look for al-Shabab who have been attacking civilians and police officers in the county.
The Kenyan security forces rescued 2 of the 4 pupils kidnapped during the Al Shabaab attack on Kiunga two days previously. No reports of clashes.
Police arrested 27 youths armed with crude weapons, who were planning to disrupt a NASA rally in Nyando.
Detonation: The IED planted by Al Shabaab, and targeting Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) along the Milimani-Baure's supply route detonated without any casualties or injuries on the side of KDF.
Property destruction: Over 100 camels have been killed and at least 47 houses torched by bandits who locals believe are security officers on the border of Kitui and Tana River counties.
Unidentified people wielding machetes destroyed a candidate's billboard.

Looting: Cattle rustlers attacked the village of Chemorongion in April or early May 2017 (the source does not incidate an exact date). The source does not indicate any fatalities or injuries. 300 livestock were stolen.
Property destruction: A group of youths attacked a vehicle carrying ODM ballot materials in Mosando, Bogiakumu. The driver said he was blocked by individuals on motorbikes.
Non-violent activity: Mr Kenneth Kinyanjui, who is fighting for the Ikinu MCA's seat, went missing on Tuesday night before resurfacing on Tuesday

Property destruction: Suspected 'cattle herders' burn down a tourist lodge on the Laikipia Plateau. The herders may have torched the lodge in retaliation to an ongoing security operation in the area. The hotel was empty at the time of the attack.
Kenya's president deployed the military to quell violence related to drought.
Property destruction: A UK national's home that had been burnt down by Pokot or Samburu raiders on 03/03.

Security Measures: More than 30 schools have been closed due to persistent attacks by armed Pokot militia in Baringo county. Closed schools include Ngaratuko, Chemoe, Yatya, Tuluk, Kagir, Loruk, Chepkesin, Kapturo, Toboroi, Barsuswo and Lokorotabim in Baringo North.
Non-violent activity: Heavily armed Somali militia/herders are reported to have encorached onto farms in Kitui, armed with AK-47s and displaced unprotected farmer settlements.

Non-violent activity: Pokot bandits have resorted to blocking roads using twigs and stones. Currently, they have barricaded Makutani-Arabal road, Norokwei-Kiserian road and speculation is high that they are likely to close the Arabal-Sirata road in a bid to block security officers from flushing them out of their hideouts.
Non-violent activity: on 25 December, a group of suspected Pokot militia raided a village near Arabel and forced locals who were attending a church service to flee. No one was injured.
Property destruction: Offices of the Vihiga County government are destroyed by unidentified arsonists.
Movement of forces: Al Shabaab enters two villages in Ijara sub-county, forcing residents to hear a lecture in their local mosque.

Defusal: Military forces foil an ambush on a convoy in Lamu by identifying IEDs and detonating them. No injuries. The security forces are reportedly in pursuit of the suspected attackers in the area. The planned attack and subsequent security sweep took place on 12/07.
A threat is announced and a bomb later discovered in a Catholic church in Kutu. Its discovery caused congregants to panic and flee. Police later detonated the explosive without injury.
Al Shabaab forces briefly take over Basuba in Lamu Country. Once there, al Shabaab leaders addressed the town and met with elders before retreating.
Reports indicate that Al Shabaab overtook Milimani village in Lamu on the night of 18/07. No violence was reported.

Non-violent activity: Al Shabaab reportedly erects a series of road blocks between Garba Tula and Modogashe townships [north-eastern Kenya] for purposes of extorting money from motorists. Despite these assertions, the local government denies these claims. Exact date unknown.
Al Shabaab creates a heavy presence in Lafey village effectively 'taking over' the village. The presence of al Shabaab caused several villagers to flee for safety.
Al Shabaab 'catches two military posts (in Sangailu and Hulugho) by surprise,' no violence reported.
Al Shabaab 'catches two military posts (in Sangailu and Hulugho) by surprise,' no violence reported.
Ethiopian soldiers armed with AK-47 rifles cross into Kenya aboard 10 vehicles and reportedly take over a police station in North Horr.
Non-violent activity: Ten armed members of al Shabaab hijack a bus carrying ten passengers, deboard them and take the bus across the border into Somalia. No violence reported.
Non-violent activity: Suspected al Shabaab attack a Lamu bound bus in Nyangoro. Four shots were reported fired, though no one was reported injured.

Defusal: An explosive device is discovered in Kenyatta Barracks along the Gilgil-Nyahururu road. The device was discovered before it could be detonated. Perpetrators not known. Date not provided - source dated 08/12.
Property destruction: Unidentified armed group attacks two communication masts in refugee camp; no civilians were injured in the attack, though equipment and walls were destroyed
Bombs found placed near IDP houses; police detonate and remove bombs
Property destruction: Chiefs office set ablaze by unknown armed group
Non-violent activity: Armed men surround polling center, forcing officials to change to a new voting location
Movement of forces: MRC members spotted taking oaths and preparing attacks during the elections
Property destruction: Toposa ethnic militia burns pastureland in Kenya
Movement of forces: Turkana raiders take up arms and gather for revenge attacks against Pokot ethnic group. Police kept vigil to prevent attacks from taking place
Movement of forces: Turkana raiders involved in attack against police forces said to be moving towards Nachola using women and children as human shields
Defusal: Police find grenade on bus bound for Kaloleni

Recruitment: Police raid militants oath-taking ceremony. Police reported a rise in oath-taking ceremonies used by militant groups linked to MRC to recruit youth to join their cause. The ceremonies involve military training and initiation practices

Police seize explosives from suspected Al Shabaab members
Non-violent activity: HRW report states Kikuyu ethnic group has been arming themselves in preparation for election season in March of 2013
Non-violent activity: HRW report states Kalenjin ethnic group has been arming themselves in preparation for election season in March of 2013

Non-violent activity: HRW report states Kikuyu ethnic group has been arming themselves in preparation for election season in March of 2013
Defusal: Bomb discovered in Ongata Rongai
Weapons Seizure: Suspected Al Shabaab sympathizers hijack public service vehicle near Somali border
Recruitment: MRC said to be recruiting children in secession drive
Movement of forces: Concerns that Somali Al Shabaab fighters escaping to Kenya and hiding among the civilian population
Bomb found near home of former president Kenyatta

06 May: Unidentified armed men who were suspected to be from Ethiopia attacked community elders who were on a meeting in Forole, Marsabit county. 11 were killed in the attack
25 April: A secondary school student was beaten and seriously injured by two police when he intervened the arrest of his classmate.

02 April: 'Bandits' shot dead two schoolchildren while raiding livestock in Marakawet East, Elgenyo.
01 April: A Daadab refugee camp worker was killed by unidentified armed men with his wife and son in Kericho town.
08 March: Police officer shot and killed a civilian in Elgeyo-Marakwet. Witnesses said that the police officer and a man had a quarrel over woman
27 February: A civilian was shot and killed by 'bandits' while herding his livestock in Kambi in West Pokot, on the Kainuk-Kapenguria road (approx coordinates used). No looting reported.
27 February: A woman was shot and killed and another - a shopkeeper- shot and injured by unknown 'bandits' in Sultan Hamud town. No looting reported.
27 February: A civilian shot dead by armed men in Kainuk in retliation for an earlier attack on a herder in Kambi.
07 February: A member of Kenyan police raped a 13 years old girl. [women targeted: girls]
02 February: Two dead bodies were found on the Kikuyu road. No group has claimed responsibility yet
30 January: Unidentified gunmen abducted and killed a civilian in Wote, Makueni county.
23 January: In Muruka village, a civilian was shot and wounded by a police officer who was mad after his favourite football team lost. He later died in the hospital

21 January: In Mau Narok, Nakuru county, two farmers were injured in an attak carried out by suspected Maasai ethnic militias. Maasai tribe members have been complaining that the farm was taken away from their ancestors and want to get it back.
19 January: In West Pokot county, an armed bandit shot and killed a 10 year old child.
11 January: In Bomet county, Konoin, one civilian was found dead in a tea farm. No group has claimed responsibility.
02 January: Nzoia Sugar Company Acting Managing Director Michael Kulundu was kidnapped in Kanduyi. He was tortured to death later.
25 December: In Bondo town, the west Yimbo chief, Daniel Tiang was found dead at a guest house, likely by poison.
20 December: In Siakago, Embu County, unidentified armed group attacked a 15 years old boy. They chopped off his private part and left him with deep cut on his head as well.
On 11 December 2018, a gang attacked an unspecified location in the Kegoye sub-county (Vihiga county), wounding four people (who suffered head wounds). There are no further details.
On or around December 6th, two local government officials were ambushed and killed by suspected raiders from West Pokot, as they travelled from Kapelbok (Turkana, coordinates used) to Nakwamoru.

On 5 December 2018, a gang described as being cattle rustlers attacked Koibirir location in the Elegeyo area. The attackers injured several villagers, and stole cattle. There are no further details on the event.

On 5 December 2018, an unknown group attacked Takaywa (note: unclear if Takaywa is on the West Pokot or Turkana side of the border. Coordinates for Lokichar, Turkana, have been used, at precision 3), killing a child, and stealing an unknown number of cattle. One source indicates the attack took place at Karon, in North Pokot sub-county.

During the week beginning November 26th, herders assaulted a farmer at Banita (Nakuru). The farmer claimed the group wanted him to vacate the land. The event is part of a spate of similar incidents in the area.

During the week beginning November 26th, raiders (suspected of coming from Masol village in West Pokot) attacked the village of Kaakong (Turkana), killing a child, and stealing 150 goats. One source indicates that two people were killed in the attack; two sources suggest the event took place in the following week (time precision of 2 used).

On 29 November 2018, bandits attacked a group of herders at Lobua near Gambela (coordinates for Gambela, Wajir, used), killing one, and wounding two. The bandits then stole 16 cows. The source notes that bandits were suspected of belonging to the Turkana ethnic group, though this has not been confirmed.
On 21 November 2018, alleged bandits from Pokot attacked Chemisto village in Kipchumwa (Elgeyo-Marakwet) in a cattle raid. A child was shot in the hand during the attack.

On 20 November 2018, unknown gunmen attacked Chakama town (Kilifi), assaulting and abducting an Italian NGO volunteer, and firing at civilians as they left the town, wounding five (including four children). The identity of the attackers has not been established.

On 19 November 2018, a 60 year-old woman was killed at Lira trading centre near the border between West Pokot and Elgeyo-Marakwet (coordinates for Kapenguria, West Pokot, used). The identity of the attackers is unknown, as is the motive, though the source suggests they are bandits.

On 17 November 2018, at an unspecified location along the Kisumu-Nandi border (coordinates for Chemase, Nandi, used), a farm manager was killed and her son seriously wounded following an attack by an unknown group. The source indicates the incident is part of a land dispute in the area, and also notes that the property belongs to a retired judge.
On 15 November 2018, unknown gunmen killed a civilian in Sewes (Elgeyo-Marakwet, coordinates for Endo used). The source suggest they are bandits.

On 15 November 2018, a youth Pokot militia (whose members are reported to be between the ages of 10 and 14) shot and killed a herder at an unspecified location in Baringo North sub-county (Baringo, coordinates for Bartabwa used). The attackers fled the scene after the attack, stealing 22 head of cattle.

On 14 November 2018, a member of the Baringo county assembly was physically assaulted by other MCAs from the KANU party. The attackers locked the victim inside a room in the assembly building (in Kabarnet), before beating him up. Security guards broke down the down and rescued the victim, who was taken to hospital. The event was sparked by a dispute surrounding the public service board.

During the week beginning 12th November (or shortly before), bandits killed a civilian at an unspecified location in Baringo North sub-county (Baringo, coordinates for Bartabwa used) and stole cattle.

On 10 November 2018, unknown gunmen shot at a Kenya Red Cross vehicle in Ruqa (Garissa, coordinates for Masalani used), wounding a volunteer travelling in the vehicle. Unverified possible connection with Al Shabaab.

On 6 November 2018, a civilian carrying charcoal was shot in the shoulder by a police officer in Magarini (Kilifi). The victim claimed that the officer had ordered him to stop, but he was shot even though he complied with the order (note that it is illegal to sell charcoal in the area).
On 6 November 2018, a police officer shot a fisherman at Naivasha (Nakuru), wounding him in the thigh. The police commander responsible for the area alleged that the fisherman was illegally fishing.
On 4 November 2018, two people were wounded in a 'botched raid' at Mata Bofu, likey in Isiolo south. The attackers were believed to be pastoralists from Lagdera in Garissa county.

On 30 October 2018, a group of at least five men armed with machetes and hand weapons broke into Bushiangala Technical College, attacking and raping at least five students. A suspect has been arrested.

On 30 October 2018, armed cattle rustlers shot and killed an elderly woman at her home in Gathanji, after attempting to steal her two cows (coordinates for Ol Moran, Laikipia, used). Four suspects have been arrested.

On or before October 24th, three herders (out of a group of seven) were killed and another injured when bandits fired upon them. The herders were making their way from Kapoa to Ameyan market (coordinates for Kapedo, Barringo, used).

On 11 October 2018, bandits raided the village of Chemisto in Sigor constituency (coordinates for Sigor, West Pokot, used). They killed two civilian, including a child. The bandits also stole a significant amount of livestock. The attack comes three day after a truce was signed between the Pokot and Marakwet, which had been intended to put an end to such raiding and reprisal attacks.

On 10 October 2018, around twenty militants suspected to belong to Al Shabaab attacked a school in Lafey (Mandera). The militants targeted non-Muslim staff, and threw an explosive device into quarters used by non-Muslim teachers, killing two.

On 9 October 2018, an armed group (described as bandits in the source) attacked the village of Nkiruni in Tharaka-North county (coordinates for county capital of Kathwana used). The group abducted a mother and her two daughters, and released two soon after. They also looted livestock from the area. [women targeted: girls]

On 7 October 2018, a 22 year old man was shot with arrows, and his corpse beheaded, by an unknown communal militia in the area of Mauche (Nakuru). There were over ten attackers, and four of the victim's friends were able to escape.

On 2 October 2018, during a violent demonstration at the county assembly at Homa Bay town (coded in a separate event), police assaulted a journalist from the Kenya Standard who was covering the demonstration.
27 September 2018: 2 people were reportedly killed by unidentified gunmen near Karasani town as they traveled to Lokori from Kapedo.

27 September 2018: Following an IED landmine attack the day before, Kenyen security forces raided the Daba city village in Mandara county and beat local residents with clubs and kicking them. At least 22 unarmed civilians were hurt during the event.
21 September 2018: Armed men from Marakwet village reportedly raided the Ng'oron village, Tirioko Tiaty Sub-county. According to the report, three people were killed and several others injured.

On 21 September 2018, a herder militia (believed to be Somali in ethnicity) attacked Muthungwe village (coordinates for Mutitu, Kitui, used). The group killed a man and seriously injured his wife, using machetes to do so. The motive for the attack is not clear.

On 21 September 2018, a gang of five men ambushed three people as they returned to Koromangucha village from a party in a nearby village (coordinates for Kuria East, Migori, used). One person was killed, and two others were wounded before they escaped. The attackers used machetes; there was no clear motive for the attack.

On 20 September 2018, a suspected bandit shot dead two herders and a child in Kerio Valley or nearby area as a revenge for the family failing to share cows stolen by one of the victims and the perpetrator during a raid in Tiaty, Baringo county. The attacker later surrendered to the police.
On 17 September 2018, a bread vendor was shot dead by the police near an armory at the AP line in Kigumo.
On 15 September 2018, a man shot dead his neighbour in Irobo village, Shinyalu, Kakamega county following a land dispute.

14 September 2018: A body has been found dumped in a pit latrine in Musegekwa village, Njoro county (coordinates given for Nessuit, which is nearby), most likely a result of ethnic violence that has troubled the area for some time. The victim left his house to graze his animals and was shot shortly after.

14 September 2018: Three people were reportedly killed by Police forces in the Musegekwa village, Njoro county, as police attempted to halt ethnic violence in the area. Coordinates given for Nessuit village, which is nearby.
On 14 September 2018, eight Al Shabaab gunmen ambushed a bus near Ijara, heading to Garissa. They profiled people travelling on the bus and killed two non-local passengers.

On 11 September 2018, police apprehended four members of the same family at Qababa village in Elram (Kotulo ward, Wajir). One was beaten before being released, and the other three were found dead the following day. All had been shot in the head. The police were conducting a search operation in the area following an attack on a police vehicle the same day.

On 10 September 2018, three people - including a 17 year old boy - were wounded at a field near Mauche (Nakuru). The attackers, who were believed to come from a nearby (unspecified) community, fired arrows at the civilians. It is probable that this event is connected to violence in neighbouring Narok area.

On 10 September 2018, a 13 year old boy was hacked to death, and his 12 year old sister and 70 year old grandmother were wounded in the attack in Esimenwa village (coordinates for Narok town used). The attack follows violence between the Maasai and Kipsigi groups in the area the following week (which some reports attribute to conflicts over land titles, some to cattle rustling, and others to actions by the government and/or assorted local politicians), though the specific identity of the group of attackers is not specified in the source, nor is the ethnicity of the victims. Police have been deployed to the area, and a suspect has been arrested.

On 6 September 2018, a man was shot with an arrow during a suspected revenge mission in Nkoben area near Maasai Mau forest in Narok county following the killing in the same area on 4 Sept. Tension in the community was high following the incidents.
On 6 September 2018, police killed three youth who they said were suspected criminals at Utage (Mombasa county). Police dismissed claims that these were extra-judicial killings.

On or before September 4th, off-duty Kenyan police officers demanded bribes from civilians drinking at an illicit brewery in Sondu (Kericho). After detaining several civilians, a crowd formed to release them, and the police fired gunshots to disperse the crowd, wounding a bystander. Senior police are reported to be investigating the incident.

On 4 September 2018, a herder (of an unspecified ethnicity) was killed in the Nkoben area of the Maasai Mau forest (coordinates for Mau Narok used). This killing sparked two days of violence in Narok (see separate entries).

On or before September 3rd, herders grazing their cattle in Boni Forest (Garissa county) were reportedly detained and beaten by the Kenyan military. At least eight herders were beaten, some seriously, and they have been separated from their cattle. The KDF denied that it was conducted any operations in the area.

Between approximately 23 Aug and 6 Sept 2018, a suspect in the attempted murder of a former Garissa Finance executive claimed he had been tortured in custody by the police (where he had been for 15 days) and subjected to inhumane conditions while in Gigiri police station. The detainee is allegedly in need of medical attention.

On August 27th or 28th, a police officer killed a suspected drug dealer, who had been arrested and taken to the police station, before being shot in the head (note that his death took place on Moses Mudavadi road, and that the source does not specify the circumstances). The police officer in question has been arrested in connection with the killing.
On 26 August 2018, a matatu driver was wounded in Bomet after a police officer allegedly knocked out his teeth for refusing to accept a bribe.

During the month of August, four people were murdered in the sub-district of Butere (Kakamega county), reportedly by a local gang named 'The 42 Brothers'. The precise times for three of the murders are not specified.

During the month of August, four people were murdered in the sub-district of Butere (Kakamega county), reportedly by a local gang named 'The 42 Brothers'. The precise times for three of the murders are not specified.

During the month of August, four people were murdered in the sub-district of Butere (Kakamega county), reportedly by a local gang named 'The 42 Brothers'. The precise times for three of the murders are not specified.
On 14 August 2018, a civilian was murdered in the sub-district of Butere (Kakamega county), reportedly by a local gang named 'The 42 Brothers'.
On 12 August 2018, armed men shot and killed the driver of an MP at Soy Highway Motel in Kakamega county as they came in looking for the MP.
On 11 August 2018, a 13-year-old girl was beaten to death by six Pokot youths in Nasorot village, Tiaty subcounty, Baringo county for refusing to marry a 60-year-old man. [women targeted: girls]

7 August 2018: Three Somali herders who were grazing their cows on a planted land in Ganze, Kilifi County reportedly attacked the land-owner with knives, seriously injuring him and his brother who came to his aid.
31 July. Ethiopian Merrile militia shoots and kills Todonyang chief Ekal Lochamin in Lowerangak. The militia were believed to be cattle bandits.

11 July. Suspected Merille (aka Dassanach) bandits from Ethiopia killed two people and seriously injured six others in a retaliatory attack on Olgana camp (coordinates approx) on the shores of Lake Turkana, at the border between Kenya and Ethiopia. The attackers stole cattle.
05 July. During a raid on an illegal brewery, police opened 'indiscriminate' fire, injuring three civilians.

23 June. Security officers, believed to be searching for al Shabaab remnants allegedly rounded up locals, burnt several houses and shops in Kutulo, Boji Garass, Konton and Qarsa in Tarbaj and Wajir East constituencies (approx coordinates for Qarsa and Boji). Several residents report injury.

23 June. Security officers, believed to be searching for al Shabaab remnants allegedly rounded up locals, burnt several houses and shops in Kutulo, Boji Garass, Konton and Qarsa in Tarbaj and Wajir East constituencies (approx coordinates for Qarsa and Boji). Several residents report injury.

04 May. Pokot militia attack a group of Turkana travellers at Chesitet in Tiaty, killing two. Upon hearing of the attack, a group of Turkanas residents in Marigat became angry, and in retaliation killed three Pokot civilians.

04 May. Pokot militia attack a group of Turkana travellers at Chesitet in Tiaty, killing two. Upon hearing of the attack, a group of Turkanas residents in Marigat became angry, and in retaliation killed three Pokot civilians.
13 April. A former district commissioner and three others are attacked and injured in Mwea over a land disagreement. One victim later died.

11 April. Nine members of a church group are injured after unidentified assailants attack a meeting. The reason for the attack is not known, though it may be related to a new member who had recently converted from another, unnamed religion.

11 April. Two people were killed and seven others injured after armed men raided Salima village in Laisamis sub county on April 11, 2018. The attack is believe to be linked to a rivalry between two communities. The attack is believed to be related to an attack in the area under similar circumstances three days prior
11 April. A teacher at Okimaru ACK Primary School, was shot dead in Malakisi, Sirisia by unidentified perpetrators. The reason for the attack is not known.
08 April. Three members of the same family are killed in an attack based on community rivalry in or near Salima village in Laisamis sub county.

28 March. Six people were killed and two others seriously injured in a militia attack near Kenyan border with Ethiopia. Occurring in Chiroqo, Banisa Sub County, most of the victims come from Degodia clan who have been having disputes with Garre community.
26 March. A woman is attacked and injured in an attack over land control. The attack took place in Osure Legio village in Ndhiwa, Homa Bay County.
24 March. Cattle herders killed 10 in Lopurio area in Samburu North in communal violence.

'One INGO male staff member needed medical attention after he was shot twice by armed perpetrators who ambushed the organization's vehicle. The staff members (five in total but only one was wounded) were in the vicinity of Darer Dima and traveling from Malkadaka to Garbatulla when they were attacked. Nothing was stolen from the passengers. While it was reported that the aid workers did not appear to be targeted specifically for their affiliation to an aid organization and that there has been an increase in insecurity in greater Isiolo county, it should also be noted that the vehicle was clearly marked.'

A man who was killed had his eyes gouged out while a pregnant woman is shot and her body mutilated at Malkagufu area. The attack is believed to be related to clashes between Degodia and Arjuran groups since December. It is not clear who the victim/perpetrator is in this instance. The attack occurred on or before 20/02.
Four members of the Nyumba Kumi initiative were shot, hacked and decapitated by unidentified armed group in Saria, Cheptais sub-county. The reason for the attack is not known.

More than 2,000 people fled their homes on the West Pokot-Elgeyo Marakwet border after 'bandits' burned at least 70 houses.The houses were torched in a retaliatory attack. The group stormed in, injured four people and stole an unknown number of livestock.

Evictions of local indigenous people led to the killing of a member of the local Sengwer community by Kenya Forest Service (KFS) rangers. Regarded as squatters by government, the Sengwer people have resisted efforts to move them from the Embobut Forest, which they see as ancestral lands.
Armed groups killed a woman and injured five police officers at Nyongoro along the Lamu-Malindi road
On 12 January 2018, a woman was burnt to death while her husband was shot and injured when gunmen invaded their home in Nyamira County on Friday night.

Reports from Lamu Island say a deadly attack was carried out in parts of the island. The attack was a well-planned ambush targeting a vehicle carrying 'Kenyan crusaders' travelling on the road that connects Mwitu and Gamba villages in Lamu county. Al-Shabab forces, who are waging jihad in Lamu, captured the vehicle and two Kenyan infidels, who are among those settled in the Muslim land of Lamu.
Members of the Sabaot Land Defence Force (SLDF) attacked the villages of Masaek and Kutere in Kopsiro Division in the troubled Chepyuk Settlement Scheme, leaving five people killed.
Unidentified attackers shot at a bus that was travelling from Merti to Isiolo, killing 8 passengers.
2 people were killed by police reservists in Basargeisa, in Bura.

Three women in Kitui were allegedly tortured by police on claims of insulting a local church leader. Mrs Hellen Kyalo, Ms Janet Mwikali and Mrs Kathini Mwema from Syongila Village in Kitui Central on Friday said the officers inflicted serious injuries on their behind, thighs and legs.
Al Shabaab militants attacked a land cruiser in Arabia. They stole the land cruiser and shot at the passengers. 2 passengers were injured.
Al Shabaab militants hijacked a car and abducted a driver between Fino and Sheikh Barrow. He is alive, but being held in Somalia.
A Land Cruiser carrying five passengers was attacked by Al Shabaab militants at Arabia area. The driver was released and two passengers suffered gunshot wounds but they were in stable condition.
One man was found dead in a sugar cane plantation one day after ethnic tensions between the Luo and Kalenjin communities got into an ethnic clash. The body had been hacked with a panga.
3 police officers mistaken for protesters were beaten on Saturday afternoon by other police forces in Majengo Town during ongoing demonstrations.
Armed militants (bandits) attacked a community in Laikumuku, in Tigania East. They stole 100 cattle and killed 2 people.
A group of armed men killed 2 people in the Laikumukumu area, Tigania East District, and stole over 1000 cattle.
A catholic priest was assassinated near Chiga Market, in Muhoroni.
Five people were injured when suspected al-Shabab militants sprayed their vehicle with bullets between Bodhei and Ijara, on the border of Lamu and Garissa counties.
Five people are nursing multiple gunshot wounds after their vehicle was shot at by suspected al Shabaab militants
On 14 October 2017, six people were killed in an attack by suspected South Sudanese raiders on a boarding school in Lokichogio.
On 2 October 2017, police reportedly used tear gas in a nursery in Nyalenda, injuring at least three children.
2 people were killed and 1 person was injured in an attack on Ol Ari Nyiro Nature Conservancy.
A Maasai businessman was shot dead and a young boy was wounded in an incident in Esoit, in Trans Mara. Maasai villagers believe that he was killed by Kipsigi militia.

5 Pokot men were allegedly shot by police officers deployed to flush out bandits who have wreaked havoc in Baringo and Laikipia counties. It is alleged the five were among suspected Pokot bandits behind frequent attacks targeting Tugens, Ilchamus and Marakwets.
Three people have been killed and eight others seriously injured in a banditry attack in Baragoi town, Samburu County
Armed raiders killed 2 students and injured 1 man when they attacked a commmunity in Marakwet East.
A man in Kaptet, in Marakwet East, was shot dead by an armed group from a neighbouring village.
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in Lamu county. Police have launched an investigation.
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in two villages in the Hindi area in Lamu county. Police have launched an investigation.

Al Shabaab militants ambushed a vehicle travelling from Garsen to Lamu. The vehicle drove over an IED and was then shot at by the militants. 2 people were killed. 50m away, a few hours later, the same Al Shabaab militants fired at a truck, killing 1 person. They also destroyed a nearby electricity pylon.
A soldier opened fire on 2 schoolboys in Rumuruti, killing 1 and injuring the other.
A policeman has been apprehended after shooting dead Mwenda Itaeba, a Jubilee politian who had recently lost a primary election.
At least three people were killed on Friday by Al Shabaab militants in Witu Lamu County. The Star reports 4 dead.
Al Shabaab militants attacked Maleli village, near Witu town. They burned down houses and killed 4 people.
Women from Boni were abducted and held by Al Shabaab militants in a camp, where they were gang-raped and mistreated.

The police conducted a sweeping search for opposition supporters in Nyalenda, Kisumu. They forced their way into homes to beat people. In one home they beat a six-month old baby. She died the following day. At least 10 people were killed in the searches over 2 days (split between 2 events)

During house to house searches in the village of Dago, 25km north of Kisumu, a police officer shot and killed a 21-year-old who was working with Elections Observations Group (ELOG), a Kenyan organization that has observed the past two elections.
Police fired tear gas and shot dead a man who was trying to separate to rival supporters from fighting outside Nduru Girls' Secondary School, a tallying centre in South Mugirango constituency.

Five unidentified attackers armed with knives attacked a polling station where elections results were being tallied in Hola town, stabbing one person. Police intervened, shooting dead two of the assailants. The three others escaped.
Suspected Al Shabaab militants hijacked 2 cars carrying voters between Omar Jillo and Lafey.
A police officer attempts to assassinate an election officer in Elgeyo on 08 Aug.
The ODM MP candidate and his wife were attacked by unidentified political activists while they were campaigning near Rongo, in Kanyamkago. They have been hospitalised.
Three people were killed and four injured after a passenger bus was ambushed by Al Shabaab.
The home of the political adviser to the governor of Siaya was petrol bombed by unidentified attackers. His car was destroyed. He was rescued by neighbours. No injuries reported.
Pokot bandits suspected to be from Tiaty, Baringo East raided Murkutwo in Marakwet East on Saturday, injuring two herders.
Pokot bandits suspected to be from Tiaty, Baringo East raided Murkutwo in Marakwet East on Saturday, injuring two herders. A similar attack took place at Kaben area, which killed one man.
Three people were shot dead and two others injured during an attack at Bendera village in Baragoi town, Samburu County. An unknown number of cattle were also stolen and driven towards Suguta valley
Al Shabaab kill two civilians while attacking civilians in the Mararani area.
A Baringo chief who went missing on Tuesday was found dead in a bush at Olmoran range in Laikipia county, the following day, shot.
Three people were killed and several were injured including Public Works Principal Secretary Mariam El Maawy, during an ambush by Al Shabaab attack in Lamu West.
Pokot raiders attacked herdsmen who were repairing an electric fence at Laikipia Natre Conservancy
About 1,000 people were displaced in Igembe Central, 13 people killed and three people injured following clashes along the Meru-Isiolo boundary on Monday.
Meru inhabitants stabbed 3 Isiolo inhabitants to death at Kiutine market as part of the ongoing Meru-Isiolo border conflict.
In retaliation for the killing of a herder the previous day, a group of herders killed 2 men.
4 Meru youths were attacked and killed by Isiolo inhabitants as they transported milk on the Maua-Garbayulla road as part of the ongoing Isiolo-Meru border conflict.
In Tigania East a herdsman was attacked and killed by cattle rustlers.

At least nine people were killed in Lamu County on Saturday morning, in an attack by Al Shabaab. The attack occurred at Jima and Pandaguo villages near the border with Somalia. At Jima, Al Shabaab beheaded four men (coded in other event).
At least nine people were killed in Lamu County on Saturday morning, in an attack by Al Shabaab. The attack occurred at Jima and Pandaguo village near the border with Somalia
Four men have been beheaded by Al Shabaab at Jima area bordering Pandanguo in Lamu county. Kenya Standard reports 9 people were beheaded and the event took place on the previous day.

Herders in Bambo, Mandera, have discovered five bodies buried in a shallow grave.The locals exhumed the bodies on Monday [3 July] morning and took them to Lafey Hospital.Medical personnel at the hospital told Nation.co.ke that a male body had bullet wounds in the forehead and the other bodies appeared to have been strangled.The five were from Fino Ward but their bodies were found in Warankara Ward about 65 kilometres away.

The county commander said several people have been arrested in connection with an attack on a lorry carrying camels along Laisamis Road. One person was killed. The attackers transferred the animals to another truck and drove off.

A 12 year old boy was beheaded by raiders on Sunday morning in Saku constituency. Another person was seriously injured during the attack. The attack is suspected to be linked to recent violence between the Rendille and Borana communities.
A secondary school student was shot dead by suspected Pokot cattle rustlers in Kaben, Marakwet East at 8am.
A Boda Boda rider was killed by unidentified assailants over the management of campaign money for a local politician.
In Marakwet East, a man was shot dead on Tuesday afternoon by suspected Pokot bandits.
Six people were killed and several others injured after armed Pokot bandits attacked Lokori in Turkana South on Saturday.
Three Al-Shabaab militants shot dead a Tana River County Assembly driver on Friday
A man was shot dead by a gang in Mai Mahiu on 26/05/2017. The police has yet to establish the motive of the killing.

Land invaders suspected to be from Baringo County attacked residents on 23 May at Rubere in Laikipia West. The 'bandits' paralysed a security meeting by shooting in the air, dispersing the residents and security officers. Several residents were injured as they scampered for safety.

assoc_actor_2: FORD-Kenya: Forum for the Restoration of Democracy-Kenya
notes: In Bungoma, a campaigner of governor challenger Wycliffe Wangamati was seriously injured in an attack in Webuye. Mr Joseph Kubende was driving to his home on Friday night when his car was blocked by a Probox whose occupants pulled him out and hit him with a blunt object on the head.

One person has been shot dead in Kerio Valley by cattle rustlers. The rustlers also stole over 40 goats and cattle during the Thursday afternoon attack.They also killed two goats. Elgeyo Marakwet Police Commander Tom Odera said efforts to apprehend the culprits are ongoing.
The local MCA was abducted by unidentified attackers. The police did not file a report. His body was found five days later.

Two more people have been killed in fresh attacks by bandits at Kasiluni in Kitui County [eastern Kenya], a week after a similar attack in the same area. The two were ambushed separately and shot in their farms on Sunday [14 May] in the volatile area, which borders Mwingi Game Reserve, bringing the number of people killed in the last week to four.

Member of County Assembly aspirant's three sons were found dead. The second was discovered on Wednesday, retrieved the same day and taken to the same hospital mortuary in the evening. The third was found on 18/05. The trio were missing since at least 14/05, when they failed to arrive at a church service. The children's disappearance may be related to politics.
Two people are shot and killed by raids on their farms by unidentified communal gunmen

Cattle rustlers raided the village of Ngaratuko on 06/05/2017. They shot dead two people and stole goats. Due to the recent attacks, many schools are closed and hundreds of locals are fleeing now to safer places.
Gunmen killed five civilians from Pokot and injured another 3 at Kapedo trading centre. This is believed to be a revenge attack.
An Mbita candidate was assaulted in Langata at T-Mall. Police have accused political activist Brian Weke, along with a group of 10 men, of assaulting and attempting to kidnap him.
Morans allegedly raided Kamunge village in the neighbouring Turkana County, killed one person and made away with an unknown number of livestock on Thursday last week.

A house belonging to Mbita MP Millie Odhiambo was set ablaze on Wednesday as protests erupted in Homa Bay over the ODM party nominations. Ms Odhiambo's home in Koyani village in Lambwe was burnt as residents protested after she was announced winner in the Mbita Constituency ODM nominations. No casualties were reported. [women targeted: politicians]

Gunmen have seriously wounded 73-year-old conservationist Kuki Gallmann at her conservation park in the latest of a string of attacks during land invasions in drought-stricken northern Kenya. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]
Scores are injured when unidentified armed youths launch a coordinated attack on a ODM meeting in Rongo.
A man is killed by land invaders near Laikipia Nature Conversatory
Three are injured when they are attacked by unidentified perpetrators during the night-time hours. The attack may be related to an election on 24/04. Date of attack not known - source dated 21/04.
The aspiring ODM Naivasha candidate was arrested and held, and then admitted to hospital.
Sheila Githaiga, who is running for senate in Kieni, was ambushed and beaten by 30 men wielding batons and machetes. [women targeted: candidates for office]

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'
Two suspected Islamist militants are killed in an extra-judicial killing by unidentified assailants in Naivasha. Both were suspected of recruiting and funding 'terror' activities.
A female Jubilee aspirant who is running for Tetu parliamentary seat, is attacked by four masked men armed with metal bars and a gun at Mbaaini village. [women targeted: candidates for office]
Gabra militia kills five Borana herders at Kubi Kalo; one on 11/04, four on 12/04.
Gabra militia kills five Borana herders at Kubi Kalo; one on 11/04, four on 12/04.
In a crackdown on 'banditry', police set fire to a Pokot village. An infant dies during the raid.
Raiders kill one person in Pokot north during a peace meeting
4 people are killed by herders in Nakwomuru village in central Pokot county. Police reservists engage with the raiders, killing three of them.
A young boy is killed by armed raiders involved in a boundary dispute. It is not known in the victim was specifically targeted. Exact date not clear - source dated 28/03.
A boda boda driver on the Jubilee campaign was stabbed to death by a fellow campaigner over campaign payments. Attacker assumed to be Jubilee.

The mother of Pastor Pius Muiru was found dead on 23/03/2017 in her farm in Karika village in Muranga. Police suspect that she was kidnapped and subsequently killed. Her son is the founder of an evangelical church and was the presidential candidate in 2007 for Kenya People's Party. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]
Police assault and arrest a journalist in Usengi. The scribe was targeted for investigating the use of excessive force by the officers who have been recently harming and harassing residents.
Ten people were killed and four injured in a cattle raid in Marti, Samburu, on 22/03/2017. It is believed to be a retaliatory attack run by thieves of a neighbouring community.
Police officers 'torture' a youth for unknown reason. A protest against the act followed.
